title: Categorical Data
text: document, introduce functions exploring visualizing categorical data.

title: Categorical Data
text: modified mtcars data create new data set mtcarz. difference two data sets related variable types.

title: Categorical Data
text: ds_cross_table() function creates two way tables categorical variables. want result tibble, use ds_twoway_table(). plot() method defined generate:

title: Categorical Data
code: k <- ds_cross_table(mtcarz, cyl, gear) plot(k, stacked = TRUE)

title: Categorical Data
code: k <- ds_cross_table(mtcarz, cyl, gear) plot(k, proportional = TRUE)

title: Categorical Data
text: ds_freq_table() function creates frequency tables. plot() method defined create bar plot.

title: Categorical Data
text: ds_auto_freq_table() function creates multiple one way tables creating frequency table categorical variable data set. can also specify subset variables want variables data set used.

title: Categorical Data
text: ds_auto_cross_table() function creates multiple two way tables creating cross table unique pair categorical variables data set. can also specify subset variables want variables data set used.

title: Continuous Data
text: document introduces basic set functions describe data continuous data. two vignettes introduce functions describe categorical data visualization options.

title: Continuous Data
text: modified mtcars data create new data set mtcarz. difference two data sets related variable types.

title: Continuous Data
text: ds_screener() function screen data set return following: - Column/Variable Names - Data Type - Levels (case categorical data) - Number missing observations - % missing observations
code: ds_screener(mtcarz) #> ----------------------------------------------------------------------- #> |  Column Name  |  Data Type  |  Levels   |  Missing  |  Missing (%)  | #> ----------------------------------------------------------------------- #> |      mpg      |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |      cyl      |   factor    |   4 6 8   |     0     |       0       | #> |     disp      |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |      hp       |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |     drat      |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |      wt       |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |     qsec      |   numeric   |    NA     |     0     |       0       | #> |      vs       |   factor    |    0 1    |     0     |       0       | #> |      am       |   factor    |    0 1    |     0     |       0       | #> |     gear      |   factor    |   3 4 5   |     0     |       0       | #> |     carb      |   factor    |1 2 3 4 6 8|     0     |       0       | #> ----------------------------------------------------------------------- #>  #>  Overall Missing Values           0  #>  Percentage of Missing Values     0 % #>  Rows with Missing Values         0  #>  Columns With Missing Values      0

title: Continuous Data
text: ds_summary_stats function returns comprehensive set statistics including measures location, variation, symmetry extreme observations. can pass multiple variables shown : specify variables, detect continuous variables data set return summary statistics .
code: ds_summary_stats(mtcarz, mpg) #> -------------------------------- Variable: mpg -------------------------------- #>  #>                         Univariate Analysis                           #>  #>  N                       32.00      Variance                36.32  #>  Missing                  0.00      Std Deviation            6.03  #>  Mean                    20.09      Range                   23.50  #>  Median                  19.20      Interquartile Range      7.38  #>  Mode                    10.40      Uncorrected SS       14042.31  #>  Trimmed Mean            19.95      Corrected SS          1126.05  #>  Skewness                 0.67      Coeff Variation         30.00  #>  Kurtosis                -0.02      Std Error Mean           1.07  #>  #>                               Quantiles                                #>  #>               Quantile                            Value                 #>  #>              Max                                  33.90                 #>              99%                                  33.44                 #>              95%                                  31.30                 #>              90%                                  30.09                 #>              Q3                                   22.80                 #>              Median                               19.20                 #>              Q1                                   15.43                 #>              10%                                  14.34                 #>              5%                                   12.00                 #>              1%                                   10.40                 #>              Min                                  10.40                 #>  #>                             Extreme Values                             #>  #>                 Low                                High                 #>  #>   Obs                        Value       Obs                        Value  #>   15                         10.4        20                         33.9   #>   16                         10.4        18                         32.4   #>   24                         13.3        19                         30.4   #>    7                         14.3        28                         30.4   #>   17                         14.7        26                         27.3 ds_summary_stats(mtcarz, mpg, disp) #> -------------------------------- Variable: mpg -------------------------------- #>  #>                         Univariate Analysis                           #>  #>  N                       32.00      Variance                36.32  #>  Missing                  0.00      Std Deviation            6.03  #>  Mean                    20.09      Range                   23.50  #>  Median                  19.20      Interquartile Range      7.38  #>  Mode                    10.40      Uncorrected SS       14042.31  #>  Trimmed Mean            19.95      Corrected SS          1126.05  #>  Skewness                 0.67      Coeff Variation         30.00  #>  Kurtosis                -0.02      Std Error Mean           1.07  #>  #>                               Quantiles Variable: disp -------------------------------- #>  #>                           Univariate Analysis                             #>  #>  N                         32.00      Variance               15360.80  #>  Missing                    0.00      Std Deviation            123.94  #>  Mean                     230.72      Range                    400.90  #>  Median                   196.30      Interquartile Range      205.18  #>  Mode                     275.80      Uncorrected SS       2179627.47  #>  Trimmed Mean             228.00      Corrected SS          476184.79  #>  Skewness                   0.42      Coeff Variation           53.72  #>  Kurtosis                  -1.07      Std Error Mean            21.91  #>  #>                                 Quantiles title: Continuous Data
text: ds_freq_table function creates frequency tables continuous variables. default number intervals 5.

title: Continuous Data
text: plot() method defined generate histogram.

title: Continuous Data
text: want view summary statistics frequency tables subset variables data set, use ds_auto_summary().

title: Continuous Data
text: ds_group_summary() function returns descriptive statistics continuous variable different levels categorical variable. ds_group_summary() returns tibble can used analysis.

title: Continuous Data
text: plot() method defined comparing distributions.

title: Continuous Data
text: want grouped summary statistics multiple variables data set, use ds_auto_group_summary().

title: Continuous Data
text: look descriptive statistics continuous variable different combinations levels two categorical variables, use ds_group_summary_interact().

title: Continuous Data
text: ds_tidy_stats() function returns summary/descriptive statistics variables data frame/tibble.
code: ds_tidy_stats(mtcarz, mpg, disp, hp) #> # A tibble: 3 × 16 #>   vars    min   max  mean t_mean median  mode range variance  stdev  skew #>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 disp   71.1 472   231.   228    196.  276.  401.   15361.  124.   0.420 #> 2 hp     52   335   147.   144.   123   110   283     4701.   68.6  0.799 #> 3 mpg    10.4  33.9  20.1   20.0   19.2  10.4  23.5     36.3   6.03 0.672 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: kurtosis <dbl>, coeff_var <dbl>, q1 <dbl>, q3 <dbl>, #> #   iqrange <dbl>

title: Continuous Data
text: want view measure location, variation, symmetry, percentiles extreme observations tibbles, use functions. , except ds_extreme_obs() work single multiple variables. specify variables, return results continuous variables data set.

title: Continuous Data
code: ds_extreme_obs(mtcarz, mpg) #>    type value index #> 1  high  33.9    20 #> 2  high  32.4    18 #> 3  high  30.4    19 #> 4  high  30.4    28 #> 5  high  27.3    26 #> 6   low  10.4    15 #> 7   low  10.4    16 #> 8   low  13.3    24 #> 9   low  14.3     7 #> 10  low  14.7    17

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation

title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
text: Generate descriptive statistics

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
code: # Install release version from CRAN install.packages("descriptr")  # Install development version from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("rsquaredacademy/descriptr")  # Install the development version from `rsquaredacademy` universe install.packages("descriptr", repos = "https://rsquaredacademy.r-universe.dev")

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
text: Continuous Data Categorical Data Visualization

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
text: use modified version mtcars data set examples. difference data sets related variable types.

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
code: ds_summary_stats(mtcarz, mpg) #> -------------------------------- Variable: mpg -------------------------------- #>  #>                         Univariate Analysis                           #>  #>  N                       32.00      Variance                36.32  #>  Missing                  0.00      Std Deviation            6.03  #>  Mean                    20.09      Range          1126.05  #>  Skewness                 0.67      Coeff Variation         30.00  #>  Kurtosis                -0.02      Std Error Mean           1.07  #>  #>                               Quantiles                                #>  #>               Quantile                            Value                 #>  #>              Max                                  33.90                 #>              99%                                  33.44                 #>              95%                                  31.30                 #>              90%              1%                                   10.40                 #>              Min                                  10.40                 #>  #>                             Extreme Values title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
code: ds_tidy_stats(mtcarz, mpg, disp, hp) #> # A tibble: 3 × 16 #>   vars    min   max  mean t_mean median  mode range variance  stdev  skew #>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 disp   71.1 472   231.   228    196.  276.  401.   15361.  124.   0.420 #> 2 hp     52   335   147.   144.   123   110   283     4701.   68.6  0.799 #> 3 mpg    10.4  33.9  20.1   20.0   19.2  10.4  23.5     36.3   6.03 0.672 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: kurtosis <dbl>, coeff_var <dbl>, q1 <dbl>, q3 <dbl>, #> #   iqrange <dbl>

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
text: Summary statistics Two way tables One way table Group wise summary Multiple variable statistics Multiple one way tables Multiple two way tables

title: Generate Descriptive Statistics
text: encounter bug, please file minimal reproducible example using reprex github. questions clarifications, use StackOverflow.

title: descriptr package — descriptr
text: Generate descriptive statistics explore statistical distributions

title: descriptr package — descriptr
text: Maintainer: Aravind Hebbali hebbali.aravind@gmail.com (ORCID)

what: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
title: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
text: ds_auto_freq_table creates multiple one way tables creating frequency table categorical variable data frame. ds_auto_cross_table creates multiple two way tables creating cross table unique pair categorical variables data frame.

title: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
text: data data.frame tibble. ... Column(s) data.

title: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
text: ds_auto_freq_table extension ds_freq_table function. creates frequency table categorical variable dataframe. ds_auto_cross_table extension ds_cross_table function. creates two way table unique pair categorical variables dataframe.

title: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
text: ds_oway_tables() ds_tway_tables() deprecated. Instead use ds_auto_freq_table() ds_auto_cross_table().

title: Multiple One & Two Way Tables — ds_auto_freq_table
Tabulation — ds_auto_group_summary
text: Generate summary statistics continuous variables data.

title: Tabulation — ds_auto_group_summary
text: data data.frame tibble. ... Column(s) data.

what: Descriptive statistics and frquency tables — ds_auto_summary_stats
title: Descriptive statistics and frquency tables — ds_auto_summary_stats
text: Generate summary statistics & frequency table continuous variables data.

title: Descriptive statistics and frquency tables — ds_auto_summary_stats
Descriptive statistics and frquency tables — ds_auto_summary_stats
text: data data.frame tibble. ... Column(s) data.

title: Descriptive statistics and frquency tables — ds_auto_summary_stats
Two way table — ds_cross_table
text: Creates two way tables categorical variables. tables created can visualized bar plots mosaic plots.

title: Two way table — ds_cross_table
code: ds_cross_table(data, var_1, var_2)  # S3 method for class 'ds_cross_table' plot(x, stacked = FALSE, proportional = FALSE, print_plot = TRUE, ...)  ds_twoway_table(data, var_1, var_2)

title: Two way table — ds_cross_table
text: data data.frame tibble. var_1 First categorical variable. var_2 Second categorical variable. x object class cross_table. stacked FALSE, columns height portrayed stacked bars, TRUE columns portrayed juxtaposed bars. proportional TRUE, height bars proportional. print_plot logical; TRUE, prints plot else returns plot object. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Corrected Sum of Squares — ds_css
text: Compute corrected sum squares

title: Corrected Sum of Squares — ds_css
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Coefficient of Variation — ds_cvar
text: Compute coefficient variation

title: Coefficient of Variation — ds_cvar
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Extreme observations — ds_extreme_obs
text: Returns extreme observations.

title: Extreme observations — ds_extreme_obs
text: data numeric vector data.frame tibble. col Column data. decimals option specify exact number decimal places use. default number decimal places 2.

title: Extreme observations — ds_extreme_obs
code: # data.frame ds_extreme_obs(mtcarz, mpg) #>    type value index #> 1  high  33.9    20 #> 2  high  32.4    18 #> 3  high  30.4    19 #> 4  high  30.4    28 #> 5  high  27.3    26 #> 6   low  10.4    15 #> 7   low  10.4    16 #> 8   low  13.3    24 #> 9   low  14.3     7 #> 10  low  14.7    17  # vector ds_extreme_obs(mtcarz$mpg) #>    type value index #> 1  high  33.9    20 #> 2  high  32.4    18 #> 3  high  30.4    19 #> 4  high  30.4    28 #> 5  high  27.3    26 #> 6   low  10.4    15 #> 7   low  10.4    16 #> 8   low  13.3    24 #> 9   low  14.3     7 #> 10  low  14.7    17  # decimal places ds_extreme_obs(mtcarz$mpg, decimals = 3) #>    type value index #> 1  high  33.9    20 #> 2  high  32.4    18 #> 3  high  30.4    19 #> 4  high  30.4    28 #> 5  high  27.3    26 #> 6   low  10.4    15 #> 7   low  10.4    16 #> 8   low  13.3    24 #> 9   low  14.3     7 #> 10  low  14.7    17

title: Frequency table — ds_freq_table
text: Frequency table categorical continuous data returns frequency, cumulative frequency, frequency percent cumulative frequency percent. plot.ds_freq_table() creates bar plot categorical data histogram continuous data.

title: Frequency table — ds_freq_table
code: ds_freq_table(data, col, bins = 5)  # S3 method for class 'ds_freq_table' plot(x, print_plot = TRUE, ...)

title: Frequency table — ds_freq_table
text: data data.frame tibble. col Column data. bins Number intervals data must split. x object class ds_freq_table. print_plot logical; TRUE, prints plot else returns plot object. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Geometric Mean — ds_gmean
text: Computes geometric mean

title: Geometric Mean — ds_gmean
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Groupwise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary
text: Descriptive statistics continuous variable different levels categorical variable. boxplot.group_summary() creates boxplots continuous variable different levels categorical variable.

title: Groupwise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary
code: ds_group_summary(data, group_by, cols)  # S3 method for class 'ds_group_summary' plot(x, print_plot = TRUE, ...)

title: Groupwise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary
text: data data.frame tibble. group_by Column data. cols Column data. x object class ds_group_summary. print_plot logical; TRUE, prints plot else returns plot object. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Groupwise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary
text: ds_group_summary() returns object class "ds_group_summary". object class "ds_group_summary" list containing following components: stats data frame containing descriptive statistics different levels factor variable. tidy_stats tibble containing descriptive statistics different levels factor variable. plotdata Data boxplot method.

title: Category wise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary_interact
text: Descriptive statistics continuous variable combination levels two categorical variables.

title: Category wise descriptive statistics — ds_group_summary_interact
text: data data.frame tibble. col Column data; continuous variable. ... Columns data; categorical variables.

title: Harmonic Mean — ds_hmean
text: Computes harmonic mean

title: Harmonic Mean — ds_hmean
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Kurtosis — ds_kurtosis
text: Compute kurtosis probability distribution.

title: Kurtosis — ds_kurtosis
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Kurtosis — ds_kurtosis
text: Sheskin, D.J. (2000) Handbook Parametric Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, Second Edition. Boca Raton, Florida: Chapman & Hall/CRC.

title: Launch Shiny App — ds_launch_shiny_app
text: Launches shiny app

title: Launch Shiny App — ds_launch_shiny_app
text: launch_descriptr() deprecated. Instead use ds_launch_shiny_app().

title: Mean Absolute Deviation — ds_mdev
text: Compute mean absolute deviation mean

title: Mean Absolute Deviation — ds_mdev
text: data numeric vector data.frame. x Column data.

title: Mean Absolute Deviation — ds_mdev
text: ds_mdev function computes mean absolute deviation mean. different mad stats package statistic used compute deviations median mean. NA values stripped x computation takes place

title: Measures of location — ds_measures_location
text: Returns measures location mean, median & mode.

title: Measures of location — ds_measures_location
text: data data.frame tibble numeric vector. ... Column(s) data numeric vectors. trim fraction values trimmed computing mean. decimals option specify exact number decimal places use. default number decimal places 2.

title: Measures of location — ds_measures_location
code: # single column ds_measures_location(mtcarz, mpg) #>   variable  n missing  mean trim_mean median mode #> 1      mpg 32       0 20.09     19.95   19.2 10.4  # multiple columns ds_measures_location(mtcarz, mpg, disp) #>   variable  n missing   mean trim_mean median  mode #> 1     disp 32       0 230.72    228.00  196.3 275.8 #> 2      mpg 32       0  20.09     19.95   19.2  10.4  # all columns ds_measures_location(mtcarz) #>   variable  n missing   mean trim_mean median   mode #> 1     disp 32       0 230.72    228.00 196.30 275.80 #> 2     drat 32       0   3.60      3.58   3.70   3.07 #> 3       hp 32       0 146.69    143.57 123.00 110.00 #> 4      mpg 32       0  20.09     19.95  19.20  10.40 #> 5     qsec 32       0  17.85     17.79  17.71  17.02 #> 6       wt 32       0   3.22      3.20   3.33   3.44  # vector ds_measures_location(mtcarz$mpg) #>   variable  n missing  mean trim_mean median mode #> 1      mpg 32       0 20.09     19.95   19.2 10.4  # vectors of different length disp <- mtcarz$disp[1:10] ds_measures_location(mtcarz$mpg, disp) #>     variable  n missing   mean trim_mean median  mode #> 1       disp 10       0 208.61    208.61  163.8 160.0 #> 2 mtcarz$mpg 32       0  20.09     19.95   19.2  10.4  # decimal places ds_measures_location(mtcarz, disp, hp, decimals = 3) #>   variable  n missing    mean trim_mean median  mode #> 1     disp 32       0 230.722   228.000  196.3 275.8 #> 2       hp 32       0 146.688   143.567  123.0 110.0

title: Measures of symmetry — ds_measures_symmetry
text: Returns measures symmetry skewness kurtosis.

title: Measures of symmetry — ds_measures_symmetry
text: data data.frame tibble. ... Column(s) data. decimals option specify exact number decimal places use. default number decimal places 2.

title: Measures of symmetry — ds_measures_symmetry
code: # single column ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz, mpg) #>   var  n  skewness    kurtosis #> 1 mpg 32 0.6723771 -0.02200629  # multiple columns ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz, mpg, disp) #>    var  n  skewness    kurtosis #> 1 disp 32 0.4202331 -1.06752340 #> 2  mpg 32 0.6723771 -0.02200629  # all columns ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz) #>    var  n  skewness    kurtosis #> 1 disp 32 0.4202331 -1.06752340 #> 2 drat 32 0.2927802 -0.45043245 #> 3   hp 32 0.7994067  0.27521159 #> 4  mpg 32 0.6723771 -0.02200629 #> 5 qsec 32 0.4063466  0.86493065 #> 6   wt 32 0.4659161  0.41659467  # vector ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz$mpg) #>   var  n skewness kurtosis #> 1 mpg 32     0.67    -0.02  # vectors of different length disp <- mtcarz$disp[1:10] ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz$mpg, disp) #>          var  n skewness kurtosis #> 1 mtcarz$mpg 32     0.67    -0.02 #> 2       disp 10     0.98    -0.38  # decimal places ds_measures_symmetry(mtcarz, disp, hp, decimals = 3) #>    var  n  skewness   kurtosis #> 1 disp 32 0.4202331 -1.0675234 #> 2   hp 32 0.7994067  0.2752116

title: Measures of variation — ds_measures_variation
text: Returns measures location range, variance standard   deviation.

title: Measures of variation — ds_measures_variation
text: data data.frame tibble. ... Column(s) data. decimals option specify exact number decimal places use. default number decimal places 2.

title: Measures of variation — ds_measures_variation
code: # single column ds_measures_variation(mtcarz, mpg) #>   var  n range   iqr variance       sd coeff_var std_error #> 1 mpg 32  23.5 7.375  36.3241 6.026948  29.99881  1.065424  # multiple columns ds_measures_variation(mtcarz, mpg, disp) #>    var  n range     iqr   variance         sd coeff_var std_error #> 1 disp 32 400.9 205.175 15360.7998 123.938694  53.71779 21.909473 #> 2  mpg 32  23.5   7.375    36.3241   6.026948  29.99881  1.065424  # all columns ds_measures_variation(mtcarz) #>    var  n   range       iqr     variance          sd coeff_var   std_error #> 1 disp 32 400.900 205.17500 1.536080e+04 123.9386938  53.71779 21.90947271 #> 2 drat 32   2.170   0.84000 2.858814e-01   0.5346787  14.86638  0.09451874 #> 3   hp 32 283.000  83.50000 4.700867e+03  68.5628685  46.74077 12.12031731 #> 4  mpg 32  23.500   7.37500 3.632410e+01   6.0269481  29.99881  1.06542396 #> 5 qsec 32   8.400   2.00750 3.193166e+00   1.7869432  10.01159  0.31588992 #> 6   wt 32   3.911   1.02875 9.573790e-01   0.9784574  30.41285  0.17296847  # vector ds_measures_variation(mtcarz$mpg) #>   variable  n range  iqr variance   sd coeff_var std_error #> 1      mpg 32  23.5 7.38    36.32 6.03        30      1.07  # vectors of different length disp <- mtcarz$disp[1:10] ds_measures_variation(mtcarz$mpg, disp) #>     variable  n range   iqr variance    sd coeff_var std_error #> 1 mtcarz$mpg 32  23.5  7.38    36.32  6.03     30.00      1.07 #> 2       disp 10 252.0 99.73  8167.44 90.37     43.32     28.58  # decimal places ds_measures_variation(mtcarz, disp, hp, decimals = 3) #>    var  n range     iqr  variance        sd coeff_var std_error #> 1 disp 32 400.9 205.175 15360.800 123.93869  53.71779  21.90947 #> 2   hp 32 283.0  83.500  4700.867  68.56287  46.74077  12.12032

title: Screen data — ds_screener
text: Screen data  return details variable names, class, levels missing values. plot.ds_screener() creates bar plots visualize  missing observations variable data set.

title: Screen data — ds_screener
code: ds_screener(data)  # S3 method for class 'ds_screener' plot(x, ...)

title: Screen data — ds_screener
text: data tibble data.frame. x object class ds_screener. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Screen data — ds_screener
text: ds_screener() returns object class "ds_screener". object class "ds_screener" list containing following components: Rows Number rows data frame. Columns Number columns data frame. Variables Names variables data frame. Types Class variables data frame. Count Length variables data frame. nlevels Number levels factor variable. levels Levels factor variables data frame. Missing Number missing observations variable. MissingPer Percent missing observations variable. MissingTotal Total number missing observations data frame. MissingTotPer Total percent missing observations data frame. MissingRows Total number rows missing observations data frame. MissingCols Total number columns missing observations data frame.

title: Tail Observations — ds_tailobs
text: Returns n highest/lowest observations numeric vector.

title: Tail Observations — ds_tailobs
text: data numeric vector n number observations returned type low, n lowest observations returned, else highest n observations returned. decimals option specify exact number decimal places use. default number decimal places 2.

title: Tail Observations — ds_tailobs
text: n highest/lowest observations data

title: Tail Observations — ds_tailobs
text: NA values stripped data computation takes place.

title: Tail Observations — ds_tailobs
code: # 5 lowest observations ds_tailobs(mtcarz$mpg, 5) #> [1] 10.4 10.4 13.3 14.3 14.7  # 5 highest observations ds_tailobs(mtcarz$mpg, 5, type = "high") #> [1] 33.9 32.4 30.4 30.4 27.3  # specify decimal places to display ds_tailobs(mtcarz$mpg, 5, decimals = 3) #> [1] 10.4 10.4 13.3 14.3 14.7

title: Tidy descriptive statistics — ds_tidy_stats
text: ds_multi_stats() deprecated. Instead use ds_tidy_stats().

title: Tidy descriptive statistics — ds_tidy_stats
code: # all columns ds_tidy_stats(mtcarz) #> # A tibble: 6 × 16 #>   vars    min    max   mean t_mean median   mode  range  variance   stdev  skew #>   <chr> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 disp  71.1  472    231.   228    196.   276.   401.   15361.    124.    0.420 #> 2 drat   2.76   4.93   3.60   3.58   3.70   3.07   2.17     0.286   0.535 0.293 #> 3 hp    52    335    147.   144.   123    110    283     4701.     68.6   0.799 #> 4 mpg   10.4   33.9   20.1   20.0   19.2   10.4   23.5     36.3     6.03  0.672 #> 5 qsec  14.5   22.9   17.8   17.8   17.7   17.0    8.4      3.19    1.79  0.406 #> 6 wt     1.51   5.42   3.22   3.20   3.32   3.44   3.91     0.957   0.978 0.466 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: kurtosis <dbl>, coeff_var <dbl>, q1 <dbl>, q3 <dbl>, #> #   iqrange <dbl>  # multiple columns ds_tidy_stats(mtcarz, mpg, disp, hp) #> # A tibble: 3 × 16 #>   vars    min   max  mean t_mean median  mode range variance  stdev  skew #>   <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 disp   71.1 472   231.   228    196.  276.  401.   15361.  124.   0.420 #> 2 hp     52   335   147.   144.   123   110   283     4701.   68.6  0.799 #> 3 mpg    10.4  33.9  20.1   20.0   19.2  10.4  23.5     36.3   6.03 0.672 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: kurtosis <dbl>, coeff_var <dbl>, q1 <dbl>, q3 <dbl>, #> #   iqrange <dbl>

title: descriptr 0.6.0
text: ds_summary_stats() can handle data.frame numeric vector input.

title: descriptr 0.6.0
text: Incorrect column name generates missing output (#123) Fix ggplot2 deprecated function warnings

title: descriptr 0.6.0
text: Incorrect package alias (#122) Migrate testthat edition 3 (#124) Migrate rhub v2 (#125)

title: descriptr 0.5.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-09 patch release fix CRAN notification vdiffr package remove deprecated functions related visualization statistical distributions.

title: descriptr 0.5.2
text: following functions defunct. Please use vistributions package visualizing distributions. dist_binom_plot() dist_binom_prob() dist_binom_perc() dist_chisquare_plot() dist_chisquare_perc() dist_chisquare_prob() dist_normal_plot() dist_normal_perc() dist_normal_prob() dist_f_plot() dist_f_perc() dist_f_prob() dist_t_plot() dist_t_perc() dist_t_prob()

title: descriptr 0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-01 patch release fix CRAN errors.

title: descriptr 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-01-22

title: descriptr 0.5.0
text: ds_tiy_stats() detect continuous variables data set return summary statistics . (#68) ds_auto_summary_stats() detect continuous variables data set return summary statistics frequency tables . (#69) ds_plot_*() family functions detect continuous categorical variables data set generate appropriate plots. (#70) ds_launch_shiny_app() check suggested packages available offer install missing packages. (#76) ds_measures_*() family functions now accept multiple arguments. (#78) ds_auto_freq_table() ds_auto_cross_table() allow users specify subset variables. (#83) ds_freq_table() now works continuous categorical data. (#90) minor improvements error messages. (#51)

title: descriptr 0.5.0
text: dist_* functions related visualizing probability distributions soft deprecated removed next release. Please use vistributions package going forward. shiny app soft-deprecated removed next release. Please use xplorerr package going forward. following functions soft-deprecated removed next release: ds_freq_cont() ds_oway_tables() ds_tway_tables()

title: descriptr 0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-20

title: descriptr 0.4.1
text: Feature request: add turn button app (#29) Show frequency missing values frequency table (#32) ds_freq_cont() return tibble (#34) following now return tibbles facilitate analysis: ds_twoway_table() ds_freq_table() ds_freq_cont() ds_group_summary() New descriptr following generate summary statistics: ds_measures_location() ds_measures_variation() ds_measures_symmetry() ds_percentiles() ds_extreme_obs()

title: descriptr 0.4.1
text: descriptr:::print_screen() fails variable one class (#26) ds_summary_stats() show missing values (#30) Multiple variable statistics throws error presence NA (#33) Error cross table presence NA (#40)

title: descriptr 0.4.1
text: big thanks @GegznaV @adam_medcalf contributed code, opened issues provided valuable feedback.

title: descriptr 0.4.0
